question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for demonstration purposes. Write a piece of frontend code that simulates the motion of the sun as a celestial body.

checklist.title: Is the solar motion simulation physically accurate?
checklist.description: Review whether the code models the sun's position correctly based on astronomical principles (taking into account earth's rotation, seasonal variations, or orbital mechanics). Score 0 if basic motion is missing, 5 if simple circular motion is implemented, 10 if the simulation includes proper angular velocity and potentially seasonal variations.

checklist.title: Is the visual representation of the sun properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the sun is rendered with appropriate visual effects (sun disk, corona, rays, glow) and whether the code adjusts lighting conditions based on the sun's position. Deduct 5 points if the sun lacks visual detail, 3 points if lighting effects are static. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there a day/night cycle simulation with corresponding environmental changes?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the code simulates color changes in the sky, horizon effects, and potentially other elements (clouds, stars at night) based on sun position. Score 0 if no atmospheric changes occur, 5 if basic color shifts exist, and 10 if there's a complete day/night transition with appropriate lighting and environmental effects.

checklist.title: Does the code provide user interaction for controlling the simulation?
checklist.description: Check if users can control time speed, pause/play the simulation, change viewing angles, or adjust simulation parameters. Deduct 3 points for each missing core control, and 5 points if there's no user interaction at all. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as browser resizing, device rotation, performance throttling, etc.) and provide fallback mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Weather effects interacting with sunlight 2. Realistic lens flare effects 3. Location-based simulation using geolocation). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar rendering techniques 2. Function modules unrelated to solar motion (e.g., unnecessary UI elements) 3. Excessively complex effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary particle systems). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core simulation is interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating physics calculations/rendering/user interface layers), reusability of components, and optimization techniques. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if rendering optimization techniques are absent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching in the sky/environment rendering 2) Proper layout spacing for controls and information displays 3) Professional font system if text elements are included. Deduct 3 points for each visually jarring element, 5 points for unrealistic color combinations in the sky rendering, and 5 points for poorly integrated UI elements. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the animation smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the animation conforms to natural movement: 1) Consistent frame rate (target 60fps) 2) Smooth transitions between day/night states 3) Natural easing for sun movement rather than linear motion. Deduct 5 points for choppy animation, 3 points for unrealistic movement patterns, and 5 points for abrupt transitions between states. The full score is 10 points.
